p: At the same time, negative climate change impacts are also disproportionately affecting Canada due to Arctic amplification at high latitudes [ 6]. Sea ice loss, thawing permafrost, and coastal erosion are already accelerating [ 7– 9], and impacts from extreme weather such as droughts, flooding, and heat waves [ 10– 12], as well as ecological disturbances such as wildfires and pine beetle outbreaks are projected to increase [ 13, 14]. All of these factors make climate action in Canada both vital and difficult.
